headline: Mondelez Says Downbeat Americans Are Skipping Snacks
summary: Mondelez International said Tuesday that its U.S. biscuit business declined in recent months as consumers reached for fewer snacks because of concerns over inflation and the economy.  Chief Executive Dirk Van de Put said that the U.S. market is slower than the snack giant has seen quite a while.  “That is driven obviously by a consumer that is very concerned in general about the economy and frustrated with the pricing they’re seeing,” said Van de Put, whose company makes products such as Oreos, Chips Ahoy and Triscuits.

raw.headline: Mondelez Says Downbeat Americans Are Skipping Snacks

headline: Visa, Caesars, Mondelez: Afterhours Earnings Roundup
summary: ↗️ Visa’s revenue climbed in its fiscal fourth quarter as healthy consumer spending drove payments volumes higher. Shares edged higher 0.8% afterhours. ↘️Caesars Entertainment shares fell 6% post-market after the casino operator logged a wider loss in its latest quarter as revenue from its Las Vegas business fell.

headline: Mondelez warns of bigger hit to annual profit as rising cocoa prices weigh
summary: Investing.com--Mondelez on Tuesday warned of a bigger hit to annual profit and slower revenue growth that previously expected amid trade uncertainty and rising cocoa prices.

headline: Mondelez Tempers Outlook as Costs Rise
summary: The Chicago company now expects revenue to rise 4% on an organic basis for the year, rather than 5%, due to record-high cocoa prices and rising transportation costs.

raw.headline: Mondelez Tempers Outlook as Costs Rise

headline: Mondelez (NASDAQ:MDLZ) Reports Q3 In Line With Expectations
summary: Packaged snacks company Mondelez (NASDAQ:MDLZ) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 5.9% year on year to $9.74 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.73 per share was 2.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Trump-Xi Meeting, Microsoft Earnings, Fed Rate Decision: What to Watch This Week
summary: President Trump is poised to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, following constructive weekend trade talks between Washington and Beijing. Investors will also tune into earnings from Apple, Amazon and Microsoft, plus the first Federal Reserve policy-setting meeting since the government shutdown began.

raw.headline: Trump-Xi Meeting, Microsoft Earnings, Fed Rate Decision: What to Watch This Week
